name: md5

readme.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/md5/latest/md5/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate md5Copy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/md5/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/md5/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/md5/latest/src/md5/lib.rs.html#1-438)
Expand description
The [MD5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MD5) hash function.
### [§](https://docs.rs/md5/latest/md5/#example)Example
```
let digest = md5::compute(b"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz");
assert_eq!(format!("{:x}", digest), "c3fcd3d76192e4007dfb496cca67e13b");
```

### [§](https://docs.rs/md5/latest/md5/#security-warning)Security Warning
The package is provided for the purposes of interoperability with protocols and systems that mandate the use of MD5. However, MD5 should be considered [cryptographically broken and unsuitable for further use](https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/836068). Collision attacks against MD5 are both practical and trivial, and [theoretical attacks against MD5 have been found](https://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1724151).
[RFC6151](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6151) advises no new protocols to be designed with any MD5-based constructions, including HMAC-MD5.
## Structs[§](https://docs.rs/md5/latest/md5/#structs)

[Context](https://docs.rs/md5/latest/md5/struct.Context.html "struct md5::Context")
    A context.

[Digest](https://docs.rs/md5/latest/md5/struct.Digest.html "struct md5::Digest")
    A digest.
## Functions[§](https://docs.rs/md5/latest/md5/#functions)

[compute](https://docs.rs/md5/latest/md5/fn.compute.html "fn md5::compute")
    Compute the digest of data.

readme_summary: The `md5` crate provides an implementation of the MD5 hash function, allowing users to compute digests for data via its `compute` function. It includes structs like `Context` for incremental hashing and `Digest` for handling computed hashes. Note that MD5 is considered cryptographically broken and should only be used for compatibility with legacy systems or protocols.
factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Hash Function Implementation  
✅ Factual: The `md5` crate provides an implementation of the MD5 hash function, allowing users to compute digests for arbitrary input data using the `compute` function.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `md5` crate provides a cryptographically secure hash function suitable for modern security applications, including password hashing and digital signatures.  

---

### Pair 2: Security Warning  
✅ Factual: The `md5` crate explicitly warns users that MD5 is cryptographically broken and unsuitable for secure applications due to practical collision attacks.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `md5` crate guarantees the security of the MD5 algorithm for use in cryptographic protocols and advises its use for sensitive data.  

---

### Pair 3: Example Usage  
✅ Factual: The `md5` crate allows users to format computed digests as hexadecimal strings, as demonstrated in its example code: `format!("{:x}", digest)`.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `md5` crate automatically formats computed digests as hexadecimal strings without requiring explicit formatting by the user.
